intro: Hedyotis pentamera, commonly known as the five-lobed bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers clustered in dense inflorescences, and its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy. Hedyotis pentamera belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. It is valued in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
